content:
What a wonderful idea! Inviting your mom's old college friends to join the family celebration can make the occasion even more special and meaningful. It's a great way to reunite her with people who were an important part of her life during that time.

Here are a few things to consider when inviting her college friends:

1. **Reach out in advance**: Give them plenty of notice so they can clear their schedules and make travel arrangements if needed.
2. **Get your mom's input**: Make sure your mom is comfortable with the idea of inviting her old friends and ask for her input on the guest list.
3. **Keep it intimate**: Depending on the size of your family gathering, you may want to limit the number of college friends invited to keep the celebration intimate and manageable.
4. **Plan activities**: Consider planning some activities or games that will encourage mingling and storytelling among the college friends, such as a "remember when..." session or a slideshow of old photos.
5. **Make it a surprise**: If you want to make it an extra-special surprise for your mom, you could plan the whole thing without telling her and have her friends show up unexpectedly.

By inviting her college friends, you'll create an opportunity for your mom to reconnect with old friendships, share memories, and relive happy moments from her college days. It'll be a wonderful way to celebrate her milestone and create new memories with the people she cares about.

Remember to also involve your mom in the planning process to ensure that the celebration is tailored to her preferences and comfort level.
